sentences.english: The ideas of Soft Power and Hard Power suddenly occurred to me.
sentences.chinese: 有关“软力量与硬力量”的想法就这样倏忽而来。

sentences.english: Those of black smoke came damp, suddenly, the guy red sad.
sentences.chinese: 羞涩的眼色碰上受潮的烟，倏忽，哀愁的眼孔通红。

sentences.english: For this swift death, a man usually struggles for a long time of his whole life.
sentences.chinese: 为这倏忽一死，往往要痛苦地挣扎漫长的一生。

sentences.english: Already ten years has passed since my retirement and drift apart from society.
sentences.chinese: 退离工作岗位，淡出社会生活，倏忽十有余年。

sentences.english: The bright landscape rolled past the windows.
sentences.chinese: 明亮的景色在窗前倏忽闪过。

sentences.english: More than ten years has quickly passed away since I retired and began to stay away from public activities.
sentences.chinese: 退离工作岗位，淡出社会生活，倏忽十有余年。

sentences.english: Any transient inspiration in fact does not take the place of kungfu for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 任何倏忽的灵感事实上不能代替长期的功夫。

sentences.english: When he turned and confronted it, the thing had vanished.
sentences.chinese: 他回过头来正对它看时，那东西却倏忽不见了。

sentences.english: It took Cindy quite a while to catch on to what Bill was stating.
sentences.chinese: 辛迪许久自此才倏忽明白比尔所说的话。

sentences.english: But it won't be anytime soon.''
sentences.chinese: 但是这还得很长一段时间，不能倏忽一下。

definition: in the twinkling of an eye/in a flash/to turn one's eyes
in the wink of an eye/in a flash
(of passing time) in an instant/(of a sight) in a flash
